description:
Mycelia is a dynamic game of tactics in a competition for space and resources to create your own mushroom kingdom. The game follows the life cycle of fungi, a journey of creation, expansion, death, and rebirth — in game terms, growing mushrooms to score points, sporing them to expand your mycelial network, and eventually seeing them decay to unlock special actions.

On a turn, a player has two actions to perform from the six options available. Using your decay actions, stealing spores, and blocking other mushrooms are just some of the ways to get ahead in the game. Players can evolve their own playing style, perhaps playing more aggressively to steal other players' spores or disrupt their mycelial network — or perhaps playing more defensively to try to protect their own area and spores.

The board is made up of triangle tiles that represent different environments and nutrients that the mushrooms need to grow. These tiles can be added to the board by the players, so the board is always growing and evolving.

Mycelia incorporates beautiful and accurate botanical style illustrations with over 69 mushrooms that can be found in the wild.

—description from the publisher
Simple card game where you collect card sets to complete long (or tall) animals which span across 2 or 3 cards.

You are the high priests of Light and Darkness, and your patron deities have been at war for ages. The fate of their struggle rests with the seven goddesses. You’ve come to the Temple of the Seven to seek their gifts and exert your influence, but beware: the Seven do not take sides prematurely. Whenever you ask one for a blessing, she will give another gift to your enemy. Wield these gifts carefully to gain control of the temple.
Piously is a two-player game of area control and tactical combos. You’ll be fighting to place auras on the board and convert enemy auras to your own. If you form a connected region of auras that touches all seven rooms of the temple, you win!

In a Post Apocalyptic world you must build your tribe in do battle in the wasteland for the last bit of livable land and precious resources.

Build a deck of crazy characters and followers and do battle in this all new spin that combines classic TCG deck building with table top miniature strategy.

Choose your leader and roll your dice on your way to victory.
who will you choose? Cannibal Hippies? Rednecks with gators? Perhaps you want to assemble a team of carnival clowns and cosplayers? So many choices, but a the end of the day its going to be total AnARKey!

—description from the publisher

MIRU is a solo-first hexcrawling adventure game. Set in a solarpunk future, a century from now, you play a character whose brother is killed by a robot. The next day, you pack your bag with a few supplies and foolishly head off into the uncharted wilderness to go kill the God responsible.

Noodling is a form of hand fishing for catfish that requires a person to stick their hand into a submerged hole, a place where catfish often lie, and wiggle their fingers in hopes that a fish bites onto their hand.

This card game captures that theme with rounds of hidden bids that each player can opt to try push luck on their own in a fishing hole or potentially team up with a partner just in case they land a huge one that they need help with!  There is always the risk that you find a monster catfish that you are unable to bring in on your own and causes you to lose some of your previous catch.

—description from the designer

Gnaughty Gnomes is a fixed partnership, may-follow trick-taker that features a hex board, with each hex color coded to represent the varied quality of mushrooms growing in the forest.  The game is played over the course of a single hand which consists of 9 cards per player.

The result of each trick will assign the players different special actions, based on their position within that trick, for their play of a gnome to the board. Each placement is assessed for area majority conditions and the immediate scoring of any gathered mushrooms as victory points. Clever teamwork by placing your naughty gnomes to score the most potent mushrooms will determine the winner.

—description from the designer

This choose-your-own-path, board game/novel hybrid, offers a wondrous new way to experience the world of the Greenflame Forest amidst the return of the goddess Adrimon. Play through the Forests of Adrimon (Volume II) in an entirely new way and drive the unfolding of a complex and epic story with the heroes you choose at the story's core. Your heroes will be pulled into the narrative and their decisions will guide how the story unfolds.

You will only experience a fraction of the content during each play-through, which means your games can unfold differently each time you play. Gain epic gear, unique campaign-only equipment and statuses, and power level your heroes throughout the entire length of the story. You will find that the allies you make, and the statuses and campaign items you gain may affect the story in completely different and unforeseeable ways in the future.

—description from the publisher

3.05 kg

Totemix is an asymmetric cooperative game, resembling a dynamic puzzle. Players take on the roles of totem animals with unique powers fighting to defend their lands.
The game includes several starting map layouts, different difficulty settings and two game modes (standard or real-time).
Your options are limited making each action critical: your can move to an adjacent tile or activate your special power.
End game conditions depend on the selected scenario.

You're the chieftain of your clan and are in charge of making your clan safe from Monsters, while keeping a competitive advantage against other clans. Some of the inhabitants are in hiding, and you need to figure out which inhabitant is where, and chase any Monster to the Open Highlands or rivalling clans.

This game is all about memorising cards, taking calculated risks, and strategic long-term decision-making.

It's super easy to learn (5 minutes), fun for the whole family (2-6 players), and can be replayed over and over again.

HOW IT WORKS

Start of the game
Every chieftain starts with four cards faced down in front of them. This is your clan, and each card is one of its inhabitants. To start, each player may peek once at the bottom two cards. Remember them well.

Objective
The goal is to get rid of the Monsters in your clan by chasing them to your opponents or the open Highlands. Each card has a set amount of points, the scarier the monster, the more points it has. So the aim is to have the fewest amount of points. Once you think you're in that position and no longer have any Monster cards in your clan, you can call 'Saorsa' ("freedom" in Gaelic) and after one final turn by each player, the round will end.

During a turn
Option A) You take the top card from the discard pile (Open Highland pile) and swap it with one of your clan cards - any actions displayed on the card cannot be taken.

Option B) You take the top card from the closed pile and choose:
1. Place it directly on the Open Highland pile and perform the action as described on the card.
2. Swap it with one of your clan cards - any actions displayed on the card cannot be taken.

Whenever a card is discarded on the Open Highland pile, any player that knows the position of that same card in any of the clans may quickly grab that card and place it on top of the discarded card. This is how you get fewer inhabitants in your clan.

There are a number of special cards in the game, there is a Witch who allows you to peek at one card each turn or the Evil Priest of Forvie, who will no longer be evil once he is converted by the Missionary. So taking big calculated risks can have big rewards, just like in real life.

End of the round
If you don't have any monsters in your clan, just before it's your turn, you can declare 'Saorsa'. Every other player will take one last turn and the round ends and points will be counted. If the player that called Saorsa has the lowest amount of points, she or he will win a Victory Token.

Some cards in your clan might not seem too good at first sight, containing too many points, but keeping them in your clan will give you great advantages in future rounds.

The game ends when all four Victory Tokens have been won.

-description by designer

Boardgame based on a Belgian TV quiz. There are 5 different rounds to play. Depending on where your meeple is on the board you get a certain round question. With a good answer(s) you will advance on the board until someone will reach the final.

From that moment the final will be played. All players receive questions from the final round. With each good answer, the other meeples will go back one spot. This will continue until only one player is left.

—user summary

Do you like Battle Royales and getting together with your friends? We made a Battle Royale you can get together and play with your friends! By combining the simplicity of a party game with the strategy of competitive trading card games, Counter Warfare lets you drop in and have a great time fighting your 'IRL' friends and fam over-and-over-and-over.

The game also takes an average of 3 minutes to learn due to the fact that all the cards tell you exactly how to play them. It has 104 Unique, Balanced, Beautiful cards, divided into 2 card types and 4 rarities.  In this game, your cards are your life, so there are no trackers, dice, or anything else required to play the game. Just the cards.

Players take turns choosing the best play for their turn to get rid of all opponent cards while still keeping some in their hand.

When the deck runs out, players discard cards on their turn instead of drawing, ensuring that there will always only be 1 winner.

—description from the designer

Welcome to Homeland – A 2-6 player, fantasy, strategy, and barter card game – where an entire world fits into your pocket!
Homeland aims to fill the void between a simple party game and a complex strategy game. It is perfect for those who gravitate towards strategy games, those who standardly don't have interest in games, families, and everyone in between. It is extremely simple to pick up for first timers, and each round only takes about 15-30 minutes.

The game contains 53 cards. Players will live in one of six regions with a distinct terrain and climate, represented through cards. You also have "tamed beasts" cards with which you maximize your strength through combinations of the beast cards whose power is tied to climate and terrain of the region cards. Use Military Might cards which capitalizes on their terrain and brethren. Construction & Agriculture cards provide additional bonuses based on climate. Players can also utilize Climate Change effects to alter all Homelands and World Effects to damage specific climates and terrains.

Players will rely on luck, strategy, and bartering ability to lock-in five cards over the course of the game to create the strongest Homeland!

—description from the designer

HOMELAND - The Rules
PocketableGames.com
Players 2-6 I Time: 15-30min I Ages: 10+
SETUP:
-Each player randomly receives one of the six HOMELAND cards; your HOMELAND has a Climate and Terrain
-Your HOMELAND card is placed faceup and visible to all players
-Remove the remaining HOMELAND cards from play
-The Hand: Shuffle and deal 7 new cards to each player. These cards are MILITARY, AGRICULTURE, TAMED BEAST, WORLD EFFECT, and CLIMATE CHANGE cards -they award or penalize points based on your Climate and Terrain as well as complementary bonuses
GAMEPLAY:
-One randomly selected player begins as the Lead and places a card from their hand faceup on the table as the main offering
-All other players simultaneously offer a card they would be willing to trade the Lead 
-The Lead may either accept a single trade or discard their own offering and draw a new card (if the deck is empty you must trade) 
-The traded/untraded cards are returned to their owner's hand
-The Lead locks in a card from their hand facedown to strengthen their HOMELAND
-Play passes to the right, the new Lead repeats the above steps
-The game is finished when all players have locked in 5 cards finalizing their HOMELAND
SCORING:
-Players reveal, starting with the initial lead and passing right, if they locked in any Climate Change cards; effects take place in order of reveal
-Players then total their remaining locked in cards
-The HOMELAND with the most points is the winner!

Tricksdale  is a game of diplomacy and resource management in which 3 to 6 players compete to win the king's favor by building the most illustrious district.

In Tricksdale, there are 5 clans that compete to dominate the valley: cats, mice, canines, owls, and bears. Players must leverage their influence over all clans to obtain the resources they need to attract the right business.

The game is played over 3 hands (e.g., seasons). At the beginning of each season, players receive 7 cards representing the clans and the resources players influence over.

Throughout each round, players will go through the stages that include:


     Assembly: In this stage, players Play cards to gain resources and determine which clan is the most influential one in the next round
     Trade: Each player can gain a business and add to their district. Alternatively, players may sell resources and obtain contracts from the royal court.
     Collection: Each business established in the player's district can provide a special bonus triggered by the result of the assembly stage. Players may gain additional resources, gold, or victory points.


The season ends when all players have exhausted the cards in their hands. After all 3 seasons, the player with the highest victory point wins.

-description from designer

Card Barrage is a head-to-head dexterity-based tower defense game. Players hone their dexterity skills and finesse at card tossing through attacking your opponent’s castle. At the start of the game, players lay out a card to represent their castle and its surrounding wall cards. Each turn, players physically toss cards against the other player’s castle and surrounding wall cards. Players score points when their barrage cards land on the other player’s castle or wall cards. Wall cards can be damaged and destroyed through attacks. You can play solo, head-to-head or team vs team. Rules govern how you can toss cards to attack through the lob, Frisbee, or flip method.

OBJECTIVE – The objective of Card barrage is to score points through attacking your opponents’ castle and castle walls. Successfully tossed cards that land on your opponent’s castle or is surrounding wall cards will score a point.
GAME PLAY – Each turn players may build a wall, upgrade a wall, and attack. Build a wall by playing a card into a previously destroyed wall section. Upgrade a wall by exchanging a wall card with a card in hand. If you did not build a wall, attack an opponent’s castle and wall by tossing a card to score points.
GAME END AND WINNING – The game ends when one player has scored 10 points or destroyed all their opponent’s walls and then hits their opponent’s castle with all players getting an equal number of turns. The player with the most points wins.
THEME – Medieval Setting and Castle sieges

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the land of happy dinos! Our dinos are ready to play with you. Roll the dice to find their matching hidden eggs. Be the first to collect six dinosaurs to win! Memory and a little luck will help you succeed in this fun prehistoric eggspedition!

Contents: 12 Wooden Dinosaurs. 12 Wooden Coloured Eggs. 4 Scoring Boards. 2 Wooden Coloured Dice. Illustrated Rules

It's always flowering season in sunny Singapore! In Oh My. Orchids!, you want to gather seed cards to plant in your garden different types of Singaporean flowers, from dazzling heliconias to delicate orchids. Lots of thorny decisions await you in this flowery game of hand management and set collection.

On your turn, either gather seeds from the display or plant flowers. To collect seed cards, take all cards from the five-card display that share a color or share the number of seeds; if you end up with more than seven cards, discard to seven, losing 1 point for each wasted card. Planting flowers requires you to match the seed requirements of the different flowers in the display. Orchids are harder to match, but earn the most points. Once one player has at least seven flowers, everyone else has one more turn to plant, then you tally your points, earning a bonus if you have at least four types of flowers. Whoever has the most flower points wins.

—description from the publisher

Missed friend's birthday? No worries, you have a good excuse: you had a sleeping kitten lying on your lap, you had to wait until he wakes up. In this game, you will find out absurd and wild excuses are suits you according to your friends.

Each turn, you make up excuses from random cards and vote which of your friends (or maybe you yourself?) Could really screw up and get off like that.

The goal of the game is to socialize and have fun, but you can also play for victory points.

—description from the publisher

Gent Expert is a question and answer game.
You roll the dice to pick a category and score points.
Categories:

     History, Politics, Geography
     Showbusiness, Sports
     Tourism, Culture and gastronomy
     Shopping, Economics


Gain Points with the right answer, loose points with the wrong one.

It's all about the Beautiful City, Ghent in Belgium.

Great adventure, fame, and untold riches — all this is waiting for the Black Hole Buccaneers. In the game, the players' task is to collect ancient collectibles from the orbit of black holes, objects dumped there hundreds of years ago as mankind's chosen place for the final disposal of garbage. Among the 99 cards in the game are artifacts and relics that have powerful effects, as well as toys that are not particularly valuable in the year 2642, but that are in great demand by other species. In exchange, these species offer their help in escaping the black holes into which players will be drawn when the collected space debris exceeds their threshold for release. The player who best manages to master the dangers of outer space after three rounds of the drafting game and collects the most valuable items will win.

Black Hole Buccaneers is a fast-playing drafting game which not only offers new situations and a lot of interaction with other players, but also difficult decisions due to various card effects. In each round, everyone at the table plays one card and passes the remaining cards to their neighbor. Whoever can escape the black hole in the scoring phase of a round gets to score their collected items and thus comes a little closer to victory.

-description from publisher

Immerse yourself in Mexican culture in a game that will make you relive the adventures and challenges of breaking a piñata.

To win, you just need to have good aim and play wisely to collect the candies and toys that add up to the highest score at the end of the game, or be the lucky one who manages to form the word PIÑATA with the Palo Dice.

—description from the publisher

Ript Showdown features two options on each card, allowing disc golfers to choose a side to play based on their style.

Players begin the round with 3 cards and draw additional cards based on their score for each hole. You can be Good and play a defensive game or Bad and attack your opponents mercilessly. Either way you hope to be Lucky in the end and pull off a win!

In Witchy Cakes, you play witches competing to make the tallest, most enchanted cake possible to deliver unto an unsuspecting wedding reception.

Pick from adorable Covens to represent your witchy bakery and match colors to stack your cake cards into a tower. Then, throw cake at your friends, vie for coveted Recipe cards, and time your Secret Ingredients just right to have the tallest cake when the bell chimes thrice!

With easy-to-learn gameplay and a quick playtime, it's the perfect game for all ages, starting at 8 years old. Plays 4-8 players for 15-20 minutes. (Did we mention it's colorblind friendly?)

Are you for people? Or will you send the kingdom into anarchy? Social deduction meets resource management in this palace intrigue game.

Anarchy is an event-based resource management game putting a twist on the classic social deduction genre. Players are their kingdom's newly elected council members — each with a hidden objective and tasked with balancing their self-interests with the kingdom's well-being.

Players must work together to prevent their kingdom from falling into Anarchy whilst simultaneously plotting against each other to achieve their unique objective. But, be careful because amongst your friendly council members are Anarchists who are trying to sew descent and throw the kingdom into Anarchy.

Anarchy is just a vote away. Trust no one.

Follow our project on Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/westargames/anarchy-trust-no-one

—description from the publisher

Postcard Brittany is a relatively fast and simple - NO "Zones of Control!" - but historical little 6-turn sudden-death postcard wargame about General George Patton's August 1944 coup de main attempts to grab the major French ports of Brittany, before the Germans could organize their defenses.
Regimental level: 14 German units, 3 French FFI groups, and 11 US units in hex-and-counter format.
1-4 player game with at least initially hidden German units spread out in the peninsula.
Allied movement impeded by Strassesperren - roadblocks - as well as German units ... as well as traffic jamming on roads.
FFI groups can recon unknown German units, destroy undefended German roadblocks, and block German retreats.
Patton's special engineer-equipped Task Force A included, and it can be 'decisive.'  (Thanks, George.)

Historically, Patton failed, chafing at the corps commander's hesitancy, but you can do better. Right? :-)

Good solitaire game - or in very large format, team game - with US 4th and 6th Armored Divisions necessarily going down separate east-west roads.

—description from the designer

In 7 Rounds you try to collect the most points in 7 rounds.
During the entire game, every player has 4 cards in their hand.
Improve these cards by taking new cards from the draw pile and playing cards or steal the best cards from your opponent.
Every card contains a special effect that can work in your advantage, but you can lose your cards as well! Additionally, every card has a special effect that can turn the game completely.

Try to have the most points in your hand at the end of the game. During the 7 rounds, you take a card from the draw pile and you play a card. Every card contains a unique effect that can turn the game upside down. Steal cards from your opponent, or make every player discard two of their highest cards when they have more than 18 points! The player with the most points after 7 rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher

For weeks, a mad zeppelin, the Relempago, has been roaming the skies.

He has killed his entire crew, and robots in his pay are capturing new victims.

Now it's your turn to be locked up on board the flying ship!

You'll have to solve the machine's riddles and put it out of action in order to be the first to tell the story of your adventure aboard the airship.

With great photos and surprising facts / figures about 175 animals from all over the world!

In this new trick-taking card game for 2-5 players ages 8 and up, one gets excited at the diverse animal kingdom! Everyone learns about the often amazing measurements and characteristics of each animal by constantly comparing the four categories of "size," "weight," "age," and "speed." Because both the highest and the lowest value can sting, it is possible to win in one category, for example, with the ant against a much larger animal, such as the cat (same game principle as in the first two games "Länder toppen!" and "Inseln toppen!"). But beware, there are also predators who can reshuffle the cards again within one trick ...

Simple rules, exciting gameplay!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Exilegard is an open source miniature skirmish wargame where you lead a warband of exiles through a dying far far future sci-fantasy setting. The game uses preplanned alternating activation and asymmetrical RPS combat with dice. Your warband has a common pool of HP and you choose if miniatures die when they take damage. You will also need to pay attention to cover and flanking in order to win.

—description from the designer

Rediscover, through a journal, the story of a legendary character - this time it's Merlin the Magician.

Players progress in the story by collecting survival items and using these to solve a series of puzzles, which become progressively more difficult.
Players must solve all puzzles to finish the game.

Rediscover, through a journal, the story of a legendary character - This time Sherlock Holmes.

Progress in the story by collecting a set of clues and using them to solving a series of puzzles, which become progressively more difficult.

Players work through a series of 22 Sherlock cards (Puzzle side, and Object side), 1 Laws card to try to solve the crime.

—description from the publisher

Prequel to the award-winning Veilwraith: A Veil Odyssey Game, Kreel Manor takes place before the end of the world, whence colour and life still bloomed. A last alliance of powerful heroes discovers the existence of a potential tear in the Veil between worlds, which threatens to release a plague of ancient demons upon the realm of Kilforth. Venturing forth, the heroes trace the source of this foul scourge to its origin: the ominous and deadly citadel, Kreel Manor.

In Kreel Manor players become the legendary champions of bygone times, embarking on a doomed quest to save the world.

—description from the publisher

The BIGGIES are huge space container ships. Their job is to transport cargo, but first the cargo must be loaded inside the cargo bay. Load it up as quickly as possible and be the first to pack your ship to the top!

Each player get a copy of one of six ships with a 28x40 sized cargo bay grid. Now take turns rolling 2 dice to determine the size of the different cargo pieces. For example a roll of 4 and 5 gives you a 4x5 container, that you can rotate and place either way on the grid. In this matter you fill up each row horizontally, with each block having to touch the previous, before you can start the next row on top, going from left to right. Also some special interactions between the players when doubles are rolled.

Be the first one to touch the top of the cargo bay to win!

—description from the publisher

Souvenirs d'Empire is a medium-complexity, two-player Print & Play wargame that recreates battles from the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.

Les Insurgés includes the basic rules and is the first volume in the series. It Contains :
- 1 rulebook of 24 pages with the principles of the game and numerous illustrated examples
- 1 double-sided game aid
- 1 board of 216 counters and markers to play the French armies and the Spanish insurgents in 1808
- 4 scenarios: the battles of El Bruch (June 6, 1808), Alcolea Bridge (June 7, 1808), Mengíbar (July 16, 1808) and Bailén (July 19, 1808)
- 1 A4 card and 3 A3 cards

This is a satirical game about silly conspiracy theories regarding the ingredients of the COVID-19 vaccine. It was originally released at Tokyo Game Market Fall '22 in a Ziploc bag.

Players play ingredients of a single value face down in front of them, then simultaneously reveal their cards. The player with the highest total value may play their ingredient onto the research board and move up the appropriate track (RIDICULOUS, IMPACTFUL, TASTEFUL, or INTELLECTUAL). Players who did not win draw new cards. At the end of the game, players score for their three lowest tracks.

The rules also include a co-op mode.

Dice Fights is a 15-30 minute tabletop game where the players fight to the death in a battle of dice! Each player begins the game with a set of 5 Core Dice, a Bank, Life Counter, and Trackers. Opponents roll their dice, and depending on the result of that roll, can send attacks, defend against attacks, and earn gold. With that gold you can make your attacks or your defense more powerful, can gain more dice to roll, and the most exciting... can buy and roll the box, a die itself! It's a gripping fight to the death, and the last player standing claims the victory!

—description from the publisher

An evil scientist has captured 15 different dinosaurs and is holding them in a "paddock" fenced area for his studies. The players are trying to rescue and free the dinosaurs. The game background story says this occurs on a large island near the US. There is no further reference to a well known movie with a somewhat similar dinosaur park theme.

Each person, in turn, plays card(s) to free the dinos from the paddock; or can play cards to take a dino from another player; or can build up their hand of cards to use on a future turn. Players also interact by trying to play the highest value card when a dino card is played which is marked with a less than symbol at the top. (Somewhat the reverse of actual game play which is to place a greater number than the other players.)

The game can be played using either one of two ending victory conditions: A) be the first player to release 5 dinos, or B) have freed the most dinosaurs when the game ends... after the last dino is freed from the "paddock" area.

The publisher especially intends for this to be an educational game for kids to learn more about these dinos, and to use some basic math.

In the pocket Bowling is a ten-pin bowling simulation using dice and cards based on real player statistics to generate the results of a frame in one or two rolls. The better players will statistically roll more strikes but there is still a chance of them being "out of the pocket" and a second roll, referenced against the OOTP chart, will dictate whether or not they picked up a spare.

It is primarily a solo game but can easily be played with more, each choosing a different player card to run a championship.

The game lasts 3 eras. During every era, players fight over control in provinces. 
Using dice, players can perform the following actions:

     Recruit new troops
     Send troops to the area
     Take control over roads


At the end of the era, players check who has control over provinces, castles, and roads.
The player with the most points after 3rd era is the winner.

You make only four moves in The Cheese was in its Place, so make them count!

Each player receives four mouse cards at random from a deck numbered 5-13; the remaining card is set aside face down. In the first round, lay out in a 3x3 grid nine bait cards, which are numbered 1-6 and depict food: acorns, strawberries, and cheese. Each player in turn places a card face down next to one of the rows or columns in the grid, then they reveal them, then they do this again. Whichever mouse is smallest takes food first, but it can grab cards only up to its size, e.g., the 5 mouse takes bait cards from the end of the row or column where it's located, stopping if a card would make the sum of the bait more than 5.

After resolving all four mice, refill the grid with bait cards, then play another round with the remaining two mouse cards in hand. Each trio of acorns or strawberries you collect is worth 1 point, while a trio of cheese is worth 2 points. Whoever scores the most wins.

My good fellas, we have gathered you here today to share great news and possible plans. As you know, our family is renowned and respected throughout the neighbourhood, but I ask myself this: is it enough? What if we made this beautiful city our home? For this to happen, we need to be able to take the reins from a true position of power: the mayor's office. We start by making ourselves known in every corner of the city, we must ensure that our name is not only respected but feared, as it should be!

Fictions is a cooperative game for 1 to 4 players based on the classic gangster novels of the 1920s and 1930s, also known as "pulp". During this adventure, you will play the role of a mafia boss whose objective is to gain power and take control of the city and ultimately win the mayoral elections in the last Scenario. To do so, you will have to complete two previous Scenarios in order to achieve enough prestige so that the most feared gangsters in the city join the ranks of your clan and help you carry out your ambitious plan.

—description from the publisher

A print and play sports simulation using cards and dice to replay rugby tournaments, including 15-a-side, 13-a-side and 7-a-side varieties.

The roll of a number of dice will determine the outcome of each possession with each team having a range of dice results determining who has possession and whether a try or kick has been scored. Each match can be completed in a short amount of time, meaning a whole tournament or season is possible in a reasonable time-span.

This is a hilarious game of WHO CAN BLUFF THE BEST with a Southern twist! "A little fibbin' goes a long way!"

To win a round of That Dog Won't Hunt - you have to be the best bluffer - or be really darn lucky.  If you're the only one left with a dice at the end of the game - you WIN!

Liar's dice with a Southern twist - the dice are our own design with Bless Your Heart, Possums, Pecan Pie, Cast Iron Skillets, Steaming Biscuits and of course Kudzu is WILD! HA!

—description from the publisher

As twilight closes in on once great civilizations, warring rulers make a last push for supremacy. Use the unique abilities of the different tribes to secure the future of your lineage - No matter the cost.

Gameplay overview
Draft: From a starting hand of seven cards, players keep two cards and pass the rest to the player on their left. This is repeated until all players have a new hand of seven cards.

Play: Players take turns playing one card from their hand. Cards can either be played in front of you, adding to your victory points, or be played for their ability.

Score: When the game ends, players sum up their victory points. A series of three or more of the same card type doubles the points for those cards. The player with the highest number of victory points wins.

There you have the basics of the game. Easy to learn rules that make for fun and interesting bouts of wit and timing. This is not a card game... This is a mind game!

—description from the publisher

Imperial Miners is a light engine-building card game for 1 to 5 players from designer Tim Armstrong (Arcana Rising,  Orbis), in which players excavate mines using a clever card activation system. This stand-alone game is set in the popular Imperial Settlers universe and offers beautiful illustrations, easy-to-grasp rules, and satisfying gameplay full of chain reactions and engine-building synergies.

In Imperial Miners, players create their own mines by playing cards into their personal tableau. They start from the surface and develop downward. Each time a card is added to their mine, it activates itself and all the cards above it, rewarding a player with satisfying chain reactions and combos. The cards belong to six different factions and offer various strategies. Players mix different factions in their mines to achieve the best results.

While developing their mines, players also advance on progress boards. During set-up, three out of the six available progress boards are randomly chosen for the game. These boards each offer a different strategic focus. Throughout the game, players advance to gain additional bonuses that help them develop their tableaus, activate the synergies between cards, gain victory points, and achieve even more satisfying combos. The combination of progress boards influences strategies and makes the game different each time you play.

Imperial Miners offers impressive replayability thanks to its wide range of different cards and modular progress boards. Players also take turns simultaneously so gameplay is quick and lasts no longer than 45 minutes. The straightforward rules, beautiful artwork, and rewarding engine-building mechanisms make a perfect game for both casual and experienced gamers.

—description from the publisher

Ð‘Ð¾Ð¼Ð±Ð° ("The bomb") is a game of explaining words. Everything is simple: first you explain by words, then by gestures and facial expressions, and then by one word. You choose names, neutral words, and locations and explain them each time in a new order and in a new way. By the end of the game, you can reach such an understanding with the team that, everyone will recognize Lincoln by one wave of hand! The team that guesses the most words wins.

—description from the publisher

In the cooperative and sustainable board game Summsalabim you take on the role of a colony of bumblebees and try to collect enough nectar for you and your offspring by skillful balancing.
By humming and buzzing, you lure the collecting bumblebee to the right flower.
But beware, there is also a trickier version with the mighty wizard "Pestizido" and his magic dice. Will you manage to collect enough nectar despite your dizzy senses?

—description from the publisher (translated)

An offensive on the Western Front that would be called the "Battle of Arras" but remembered for what the Royal Flying Corps called it - "Bloody April." Still flying mostly outdated aircraft, General "Boom" Trenchard insisted on constant offensive actions and round-the-clock missions for recon, artillery spotting, mapping, etc. With the most common plane involved in this work being the dreadfully vulnerable Be2C, facing up against the likes of Baron von Richthofen's Jasta 11, the results were woeful losses. To the RFC's credit, they continually fulfilled the missions, despite the losses.

The Cruelest Month looks at this struggle, with the focus primarily on air operations and ground battle abstracted (similar to Chennault's First Fight). As the British player, you will marshal your limited numbers of fighters to help secure the skies for 2-seaters that would be better suited to training planes. As the German player, you will employ your well-armed modern fighters against waves of RFC planes that simply keep coming, regardless of how many you shoot down.

Each hex on the map is approximately 2 miles across. A game turn spans two days of time. An Aerial Unit is comprised of 6 to 12 aircraft.
Published in Against the Odds Annual 2020 issue (published in 2023).

—description from the publisher

Survival of the Chilliest

You don't need to know your Chakra from your Barista to have a blast in this quick-to-learn card game. Try to keep your calm and this chill race to become a Zen Master!

Players compete to transcend first by aligning their chakra cards from #1 to #7 with a Mastery card on top. The first player to transcend 4 times wins the game! Want to prove you're the most chill? Be the first to transcend all seven levels and become the ultimate master of Zen Battle.

Get together in teams and fight against the other teams. 
The active team has 1 minute to draw as many words as possible, and scores point from each word. When times is up the other team(s) get a chance to guess the last drawing. 
A game is eaither 16 or 32 rounds. More than 100 categories and 1000 words.

Gå sammen i hold og kæmp mod de andre i at tegne og forstå hvad din makker tegner. Jo hurtigere i er, jo flere point får i.
I spillet findes der mere end 100 forskellige tegnekategorier og mere en 1000 tegneopgaver. Ens tegneopgave bliver bestemt ved at trække et tilfældigt kort og kaste en terning.
